title: The Son Of God Goes Forth To War
author: Reginald Heber (1783-1826)

v1: The Son of God goes forth to war,
Who best can drink his cup of woe,
Who patient bears his cross below,
v2: The martyr first, whose eagle eye
Who saw his Master in the sky,
And called on Him to save:
Like Him, with pardon on his tongue,
He prayed for them that did the wrong:
v3: A glorious band, the chosen few
Twelve valiant saints, their hope they knew,
And mocked the cross and flame.
They met the tyrant's brandished steel,
They bowed their necks, the death to feel:
v4: A noble army, men and boys,
They climbed the steep ascent of Heav'n,
O God, to us may grace be giv'n
